panels.description:
Note: not impacted by "Instance" variable.

A total number of active failed, and pending nodes from the cluster. 

ACTIVE: A node is alive and available.

FAILED: A node is dead and not available. The node is considered dead when the raylet process on the node is terminated. The node will get into the failed state if it cannot be provided (e.g., there's no available node from the cloud provider) or failed to setup (e.g., setup_commands have errors). 

Pending: A node is being started by the Ray cluster launcher. The node is unavailable now because it is being provisioned and initialized.
panels.title: Node Count

panels.description: Aggregated utilization of all physical resources (CPU, GPU, memory, disk, or etc.) across the cluster.
panels.title: Cluster Utilization

panels.description: The number of tasks and actors killed by the Ray Out of Memory killer due to high memory pressure. Metrics are broken down by IP and the name. https://docs.ray.io/en/master/ray-core/scheduling/ray-oom-prevention.html.
panels.title: Ray OOM Kills (Tasks and Actors)
Ray Tasks, Actors and Placement Groups

panels.description:
Current count of tasks, grouped by scheduler state (e.g., pending, running, finished).

State: the task state, as described by rpc::TaskStatus proto in common.proto. Task resubmissions due to failures or object reconstruction are shown with (retry) in the label.
panels.title: All Tasks by State

panels.description: Current count of active tasks (i.e. pending or running; not finished), grouped by task name. Task resubmissions due to failures or object reconstruction are shown with (retry) in the label.
panels.title: Active Tasks by Name

panels.description: Current count of tasks that are currently executing, grouped by task name. Task resubmissions due to failures or object reconstruction are shown with (retry) in the label.
panels.title: Running Tasks by Name

panels.description:
Note: not impacted by "Instance" variable.

Current count of actors, grouped by lifecycle state (e.g., alive, restarting, dead/terminated).

State: the actor state, as described by rpc::ActorTableData proto in gcs.proto.
panels.title: All Actors by State

panels.description:
Current count of alive actors (i.e. not dead/terminated), grouped by state.

State: the actor state, as described by rpc::ActorTableData proto in gcs.proto.
panels.title: Alive Actors by State

panels.description: Current count of alive actors, grouped by actor name.
panels.title: Alive Actors by Name

panels.description:
Note: not impacted by "Instance" variable.

Current count of placement groups, grouped by state.

State: the placement group state, as described by the rpc::PlacementGroupTableData proto in gcs.proto.
panels.title: All Placement Groups by State

panels.description:
Logical CPU usage of Ray. The dotted line indicates the total number of CPUs. The logical CPU is allocated by `num_cpus` arguments from tasks and actors. PENDING means the number of CPUs that will be available when new nodes are up after the autoscaler scales up.

NOTE: Ray's logical CPU is different from physical CPU usage. Ray's logical CPU is allocated by `num_cpus` arguments.

targets.expr: ((sum(autoscaler_cluster_resources{resource="CPU",SessionName=~"$SessionName",ray_io_cluster=~"$Cluster"}) or vector(0)) + (sum(autoscaler_pending_resources{resource="CPU",SessionName=~"$SessionName",ray_io_cluster=~"$Cluster"}) or vector(0)) and (sum(autoscaler_cluster_resources{resource="CPU",SessionName=~"$SessionName",ray_io_cluster=~"$Cluster"}) or vector(0)) + (sum(autoscaler_pending_resources{resource="CPU",SessionName=~"$SessionName",ray_io_cluster=~"$Cluster"}) or vector(0)) > (sum(autoscaler_cluster_resources{resource="CPU",SessionName=~"$SessionName",ray_io_cluster=~"$Cluster"}) or vector(0)))

panels.title: Logical CPUs used

panels.description: Logical GPU usage of Ray. The dotted line indicates the total number of GPUs. The logical GPU is allocated by `num_gpus` arguments from tasks and actors. PENDING means the number of GPUs that will be available when new nodes are up after the autoscaler scales up.

targets.expr: ((sum(autoscaler_cluster_resources{resource="GPU",SessionName=~"$SessionName",ray_io_cluster=~"$Cluster"}) or vector(0)) + (sum(autoscaler_pending_resources{resource="GPU",SessionName=~"$SessionName",ray_io_cluster=~"$Cluster"}) or vector(0)) and (sum(autoscaler_cluster_resources{resource="GPU",SessionName=~"$SessionName",ray_io_cluster=~"$Cluster"}) or vector(0)) + (sum(autoscaler_pending_resources{resource="GPU",SessionName=~"$SessionName",ray_io_cluster=~"$Cluster"}) or vector(0)) > (sum(autoscaler_cluster_resources{resource="GPU",SessionName=~"$SessionName",ray_io_cluster=~"$Cluster"}) or vector(0)))

panels.title: Logical GPUs used

panels.description:
Object store memory usage by location. The dotted line indicates the object store memory capacity.

Location: where the memory was allocated, which is MMAP_SHM or MMAP_DISK to indicate memory-mapped page, SPILLED to indicate spillage to disk, and WORKER_HEAP for objects small enough to be inlined in worker memory. Refer to metric_defs.cc for more information.
panels.title: Object Store Memory

panels.description: The physical (hardware) CPU usage across the cluster, broken down by component. This reports the summed CPU usage per Ray component. Ray components consist of system components (e.g., raylet, gcs, dashboard, or agent) and the process (that contains method names) names of running tasks/actors.
panels.title: Node CPU by Component

panels.description: The physical (hardware) memory usage across the cluster, broken down by component. This reports the summed RSS-SHM per Ray component, which corresponds to an approximate memory usage per proc. Ray components consist of system components (e.g., raylet, gcs, dashboard, or agent) and the process (that contains method names) names of running tasks/actors.
panels.title: Node Memory by Component

panels.description: The physical (hardware) GPU usage across the cluster, broken down by component. This reports the summed GPU usage per Ray component.
panels.title: Node GPU by Component

panels.description: The physical (hardware) GPU memory usage across the cluster, broken down by component. This reports the summed GPU memory usage per Ray component.
panels.title: Node GPU Memory by Component

panels.description: Node's physical (hardware) GPU usage. The dotted line means the total number of hardware GPUs from the cluster.
panels.title: Node GPU utilization

panels.description:
The physical (hardware) memory usage for each node. The dotted line means the total amount of memory from the cluster. Node memory is a sum of object store memory (shared memory) and heap memory.

Note: If Ray is deployed within a container, the total memory could be lower than the host machine because Ray may reserve some additional memory space outside the container.
panels.title: Node Memory (heap + object store)

panels.description: The percentage of physical (hardware) memory usage for each node.
panels.title: Node Memory % (heap + object store)

panels.description: The physical (hardware) GPU memory usage for each node. The dotted line means the total amount of GPU memory from the cluster.
panels.title: Node GPU Memory (GRAM)

panels.description:
Node's physical (hardware) disk usage. The dotted line means the total amount of disk space from the cluster.

NOTE: When Ray is deployed within a container, this shows the disk usage from the host machine.
panels.title: Node Disk

panels.description: Disk IO per node.
panels.title: Node Disk IO Speed

panels.description: Network speed per node
panels.title: Node Network

panels.description: Percentage of tensorcore utilization for the TPUs on this node. Computed by dividing the number of tensorcore operations by the maximum supported number of operations during the sample period.
panels.title: Node TPU Tensorcore Utilization %

panels.description: Percentage of bandwidth memory utilization for the TPUs on this node. Computed by dividing the memory bandwidth used by the maximum supported memory bandwidth limit during the sample period.
panels.title: Node TPU High Bandwidth Memory Utilization %

panels.description: Percentage of time over the sample period during which the TPU is actively processing.

targets.expr: sum(ray_tpu_duty_cycle{instance=~"$Instance",SessionName=~"$SessionName",ray_io_cluster=~"$Cluster"}) by (instance, TpuIndex, TpuDeviceName, TpuType, TpuTopology) or vector(0)

panels.title: Node TPU Duty Cycle %

panels.description: Total memory used/allocated for the TPUs on this node.

targets.expr: sum(ray_tpu_memory_used{instance=~"$Instance",SessionName=~"$SessionName",ray_io_cluster=~"$Cluster"}) by (instance, TpuIndex, TpuDeviceName, TpuType, TpuTopology) or vector(0)
sum(ray_tpu_memory_total{instance=~"$Instance",SessionName=~"$SessionName",ray_io_cluster=~"$Cluster"}) by (instance, TpuIndex, TpuDeviceName, TpuType, TpuTopology) or vector(0)

panels.title: Node TPU Memory Used

list.description: Filter queries of a specific Prometheus type.
list.name: datasource

list.description: Filter queries to specific Ray sessions.
list.name: SessionName

list.description: Filter queries to specific Ray nodes by their IP address.
list.name: Instance

list.description: Filter queries to specific Ray clusters for KubeRay. When ingesting metrics across multiple Ray clusters, the ray_io_cluster label should be set per cluster. For KubeRay users, this is done automatically with Prometheus PodMonitor.
list.name: Cluster

list.description: Filter queries to specific Ray node types (head or worker).
list.name: RayNodeType
